Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Sharon F
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - the breakfast patio is atop the sea, and the other side has a beach view - all a few minutes from the airport. But this isn't a chain-hotel experience in Cleveland. Take a taxi rather than tackling the confusing, narrow route yourself. The furnishings aren't cookie-cutter. There are coqui frogs in the courtyard and crabs skitter near the deck. The breakfast buffet was tasty but not lavish. We supplemented it with a fresh coconut, theatrically hacked open by the bartender with a machete.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: sunin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel because it was close to the airport. There was no parking except on the street. The room was small and our view was of an alley with junk thrown down it. The breakfast was processed cheese and some kind of 'meat'. There is nothing about this hotel to recommend! It's also very hard to find and should stay that way.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS HIDDEN GEM BEST BIRTHDAY EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: BootlegTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: I knew I wanted to stay in Isla Verde especially since I love beachfront properties but I had a hard time finding something decent in my budget. After cancelling 2 hotel reservations when i came across Hotel la Playa I knew my boyfriend and i would love it here. I made my reservations over the phone with Linda who was very helpful. When we arrived and saw the view of the beach we were so amazed. Our ocean view room was pretty, clean and huge. it was PERFECT!! Yes the water pressure in the bathroom isnt the best but you can manage. The food here is kinda pricey but you have to try the drinks and monfongo which was delicious. Keep in mind there is free breakfast. There is also a cheaper good quality food at restaurant called Metropol (walking distance) I LOVE that you can catch a 75 cent bus to old san juan . (A cab would be about $20 each way )Take bus T5 OR 53 its about 30 minute scenic ride. Worth it!! TRUST ME! There is also a walgreens close by where I did purchase some souvenirs. THE LOCATION IS PERFECT dont waste money on overpriced hotels. Stay here for good service from an amazing staff and great views.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in Isla Verde, stay here”
Reviews.Author: Leslie B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Isla Verde is packed with the big hotel chains, but this adorable boutique hotel right on the water can't be beat. It has so much charming character. The rooms are clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. There is complimentary parking. Fall asleep to the sound of the coqui frogs. This hotel shares access to the same beach as The Palms. For a less crowded experience, walk up one block Calle Amapola, turn left on Calle Dalia and enter the beach there. That section of beach is more tranquil...though the Ritz Carlton and a few other hotels do share a section of it.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “whatever.”
Reviews.Author: TreVaughn R
Reviews.Content: Id beat the living crap out of anybody who enjoyed this place. Me and my wife still have bite marks on our legs and feet and its been about one week since we left. Mojitos good. Food good but overpriced. Breakfast good. Nighttime patio view good. But after paying 160$ a night, I couldn't even get shampoo or razors. Death to this place

Reviews.Title: “Not so pleasant.....”
Reviews.Author: cmu5209
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in mid January. I was there with my family and we had three rooms, so this gave us an overall feel for the hotel. First, the owner and his wife are very nice. I thought everyone that worked there went out of their way to be accommodating. The view is very pretty from the ocean front rooms and from the dining area. The food in the restaurant is very good! If it wasn't for the view and the food, this hotel would have nothing going for it. From the time we arrived, things just got worse and worse. There are always shady people hanging out on the balcony of the hotel, which makes some people feel very unsafe. When one of my family members checked in they were told that the hotel is not responsible for anything stolen out of the rooms. This makes you feel really good, especially with there are shady people hanging out all over the place. Also, 1 of our rooms didn't have a safe. The safes that we did have in the rooms, are the tiniest safes I have ever seen and barely fit anything in them. The rooms were dirty and barely cleaned, if at all. There was toothpaste stains on the faucets. There were used, unwrapped soap bars in the bath tubs and showers. This makes me doubt that the rooms are really cleaned even more. The water temperature in the shower never stayed consistently hot. My first shower was freezing cold. My husband and I both woke up with some kind of bites on our legs. I have no clue what the were from, except that we got them while we were sleeping in the bed. The continental breakfast has barely anything on it. If you something else, you can get it but it is extra. The breakfast was so slim, that we ate off of the regular menu every morning that we were there. Our room was $200 a night and it's probably not worth more than $100 a night. I actually would never pay to stay there again, just because of the filthiness. The event that topped the whole weekend off happened the morning we checked out. We had all just come out of rooms and were sitting downstairs waiting for a taxi. Two couples walked in with their luggage to check in. The cleaning lady (who barely cleans) had been downstairs, right by us the whole time. Plus, we hadn't been out of rooms long enough for anyone to clean our rooms. There might have been enough time to make the bed and empty the trash. Those 2 couples were taken up to our rooms that we had literally just walked out of. I don't know if the hotel staff explained that they were cleaned yet, but regardless...what hotel takes guests to dirty rooms? Disgusting! The really sad thing out this whole situation and this hotel is that the hotel has huge potential to be a very nice, quant little place. The remodeled rooms are cute. The view is great. The food is excellent for the most part. They have a nice beer selection at the bar. But, none of the makes up for filthiness and cold showers!

Reviews.Title: “Not so Nice.”
Reviews.Author: DEBBIE A
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why so many great reviews, I think, I smell a rat here. Honest, the place is run down, furniture is very old, view? what view? we requested a room with an ocean view and what they gave us one with a view of a palm tree and the roof of the dinining room area. They charged us 120.00 per night, the food is extremly expensive. You can go down the street to the metropol and eat like a king for less money. Linda does not speak spanish, I found that odd, the office staff in the afternoon are lazy. The location of the MOTEL is excellent tho, it is in between two beaches, the one on the left hand side is the best of the two, just a short walk down the street. They do have continental breakfast, bages, coffee, ham, cheese, cereal, that was not bad at all. The price for the room is way too much for such a small outdated place.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay......Don't bother!!!”
Reviews.Author: DEBBIE A
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I were just there this past Nov/2011 for 4 days. The hotel needs works, the rooms are not great at all, furniture is old, and what ocean view? we got an ocean view room that half of the view was of the roof of the restaurant, that aint no ocean view, what we had to view was a palm tree that was close by. The restaurant is very expensive if you compare it with the Metropol restaurant which is just down the street. The staff is friendly for the most part, the lady that does the check in Linda does not speak spanish, I found that strange, she is mostly there in the morning. The afternoon staff is lazy. The beach for the right of the hotel is the best, the one on the left ewwwwww, full of algie, algie everwhere.... Breakfast was okay, coffee, bages, butter, cream cheese, cereal and some ham and cheeses, so it was not bad at all. Would I stay here again? No.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great people, best price.”
Reviews.Author: Patricia33524
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel near the airport and basically on Isle Verde Beach. The hotel is on the water but does not have a beach but the beach is just across the entrance to the hotel. The staff are very helpful and the rooms are very clean. Breakfast is basic, mostly bagels, cereal coffee, and juice. Only a few blocks to the main bus route to other tourist areas and Old San Juan and cost just $0.75 but you need exact change. Buses are slow and don't run late at night but great for the day and when you are not in a hurry. The stop is right by the Walgreens a few blocks from the hotel. Large hotels are walking distance if you want to dance, eat out at expensive restaurants, or gamble. La Playa has a good restaurant, LaPlayita, that serves great burgers and the best mojitas! It was nice to be able to hang out or have a night cap at the restaurant overlooking the water at night. Also, the drink and food on the beach are absurd so we just walked the short distance back to the hotel to eat and drink. At the beach you can rent a chair for $4 and umbrella for $10 a day. The beaches were not as nice as in Mexico but still good with palm trees and warm water. This hotel is one of the cheapest in the area. If you are fine with a small but very clean basic room, then I highly recommend this hotel. Also, you can rent a car a couple of blocks away and the taxi to the airport is around $14 to the airport for 2 people with 2 bags. Puerto Rico is expensive and not many values exists. Hotel staff were great!

Reviews.Title: “Only for young crazy people.....Oldies forget it!”
Reviews.Author: Aye-the-World
Reviews.Content: We checked-in at midnight after the long flight from Australia. Looked sleazy from the outside and not much better within. We picked La Playa because of its location on the beach and close by the airport. That is all that it's got. The noisy music was our first concern but the manager guaranteed us that the rooms were soundproof.....that should have given us the hint! The next morning breakfast on the terrace was OK but went down every day from there with no milk or no juice or broken toaster....rubbish. We were told not to walk the beach or any where local after dark or be sure to be mugged. The next night being still jet-lagged we went to bed at 10pm just when the live band cranked up and who belted out the noise until just after 3pm. With a drunken hoard shouting their lungs out it would have been madness to try and complain. When I told the on-site manager / security man the next day he said he had left before the noise started and assured me it would not happen again. They offer a laundry service but when you ask they direct you to the adjoining property where you are expected to intrude on someone else's turf. Unfortunately they demanded our payment for the 4 nights up front otherwise we would have been out of there like Flash Gordon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little secret in Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: lorieich
Reviews.Content: We didn't know where to stay in Puerto Rico as we have never been here before. My brother was traveling on business with his family and they were staying at the Ritz Carlton right down the street. We were happy to find a reasonable hotel so close to the Ritz but we were a little worried that it might not be that great. Boy were we wrong to be worried. From the moment we arrived we were treated like gold!! We absolutely loved it. As a matter of fact, we figured out a way to change our flight and we stayed an extra night. All of the previous reviews mentioned how great the restaurant was and how wonderful and helpful the staff was but we honestly weren't prepared for how true their statements were. We were treated like family. The food was great, the staff was so friendly and helpful. I hope to come back year after year and we are planning to bring our friends and family with us. The location is great. Lots to see and do and if you ever need anything, all you have to do is ask. Loved Hotel La Playa. Thank you so much for a wonderful holiday!!! We love you guys Special shout out to Linda (at reception) who checked us in and took great care of us. Julio, who helped us stay an extra night and Carlos at the bar for keeping the drinks coming and always had a smile on his face!!

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary with delicious food too!”
Reviews.Author: BarefootsGuesthouse
Reviews.Content: I am the owner of a small guesthouse here in Puerto Rico. I recognize good spots run by good people out and about on the island very appreciatively. La Playa Hotel..'La Playita'...is definately one of those spots! The staff especially Linda and Norberto along with the owners were my heros the other day. I was in town (SJ city) for a bike ride early am and sadly a lady rear ended my car...leaving me stranded and I went to La Playa Hotel to spend the entire day awaiting someone to come and pick me up along with my bike and accessories bag. While relaxing on their ocean front al fresco resturant patio..enjoying a wonderful arugula salad with salmon and a cold strong drink...was a pleasure and melted away the stress of the mornings inconvenience totally. Thank you La Playa Hotel for being such a relaxing sanctuary in San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “We got stranded because of Irene, we found this on a fluke and loved it”
Reviews.Author: MissS423
Reviews.Content: We got stranded on Vieques Island due to Irene and our whole trip went bust. We managed to get to San Juan and had no ideas of hotels or places to stay. Our airline pilot suggested this place to us and we really loved it. The place was super clean, comfortable and right on the beach. The bartender was super sweet and told us places that we should go and check out. Everyone at the front desk was really helpful, bent over backwards to help us out. This was truly a wonderful place to stay. Thank You for all your help and kindness!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jcsaycheese
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to stay here since I'm more of a luxury resort kind of guy but I'm so glad I chose hotel la playa. The staff went out of their way for you and everyone was extreamly nice. there was one night where me and my friends wanted to go to a club so we asked one of the staff (Elliot) where we should go. he told us where the best spots were but said there was a strict dress code, no short or flip flops and that was all i brought. Elliot went out of his way to find me something I could wear to the club! this is only one of many examples of how the staff went above and beyond. I couldn't thank him enough. if I ever go back to PR, this is where I'll be staying. and you should stay here too! you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: SnKBryant
Reviews.Content: We go to Puerto Rico often and this time decided a week was not enough, so we extended our trip but had to move out of our condo. We found this hotel while walking on the beach. A small hotel with great rates, great rooms, great views, clean and up to date. An excellent full bar and restaurant below, right on the water. On to the staff, I don't even know how to tell you how friendly and kind these people were. Alberto (Owner), Linda (Receptionist) and Margerite (Housekeeper) have a great way of making you feel as though you are family and they genuinely want you there. We just can't say enough good things about this hotel if you are looking for a place where you are not just a number and want your host to actually know who you are.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some improvement but it has good views and a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: abigs_FL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in March and had one of the oceanfront rooms. The view is great unless you are standing right at the windows because then you see the roof that is over the bar/restaurant and the run down building next door. However, on the plus side, you can open the windows and hear the surf and feel the ocean breeze - but screens would be nice. Keep in mind you are close to the airport and there are some early morning flights that you will hear if you have the windows open. The bed was comfortable and it was nice to have a small fridge. One suggestion is to add some hooks in the room so there is a place to hang up bath towels, beach towels, wet bathing suits, etc. The location is convenient - the beach is right there and you can walk to restaurants and the casinos. I would say this hotel was ok, I am not sure that I would stay again but it certainly has a charm about it, a great location and a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: pmarielNYC
Reviews.Content: Hotel La Playa is a simple, small, clean hotel right on the beach, and 20 minutes from the airport. If you want a no frills experience with very friendly staff and very easy beach access, this is a good bet. Our double room had two double beds, A/C, ceiling fan, and a large bathroom with a stall shower. Plenty of towels, shampoo, and soap were provided, as were beach towels (those we had to ask for). Beach Access: You actually have access to two different beaches. Picture the coastline as a "W" -- Hotel La Playa is located at the tip of the middle apex of the W. Across the street from the front of the hotel is one long stretch of beach, but if you exit the hotel via set of steps and hop off of a rock on the restaurant side, you've got access to the other stretch of beach. Bar/Restaurant: La Playita, open to the public, is the open-air bar/restaurant on the ground floor, overlooking the ocean. It's a beautiful spot, save for the abandoned building next door that's a bit of an eyesore. Drinks (prepared by Blake, the bartender) were great, and the food was pretty good too. A plentiful continental breakfast (juice, coffee, bagels, cold-cuts, sliced cheese, scones, cookies) is included with the room rate. On our last night, a Saturday, the bar area had a musician singing and playing guitar in the evening. My one complaint about my experience at Hotel La Playa is that there was quite a bit of noise coming from the courtyard late on a Saturday night such that my sleep was disturbed (but then again, I'm a light sleeper).

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay :-)”
Reviews.Author: YellowDia
Reviews.Content: We've heard of this hotel from friends that I gone there previously and said they loved it! Also, after looking at many different hotels that were on or close to the beaches, we realized that they were extremely expensive (200-350) and they didn't even include continental breakfast! So we reserved the playita hotel for 2 days and then took a cruise from san juan. The hotel is literally located at the end of a street that is on the beach. This hotel is a hidden jewel. There is only one narrow street that directs you to the hotel so mark sure to rent a small compact car if planning to. There is very limited parking so you must speak with the valet driver to reserve a parking spot. At the register we were welcomed by a loving staff. We checked in but the only thing that was somewhat strange was that they charge ur credit immediately there when u first arrive and not at check out. Also, I had many visa mastercard gift cards from my wedding, and they couldn't use them because they were not familiarize and their credit card machine wouldn't process them. So, we paid for our room for 2 nights and it came out to a grand total of $205 with continental breakfast that would include bagels, cream cheese, fruits, cheeses, lunch meats, cereal and juices ( better something than nothing ). Our room was small, with modern wooden and eco-friendly furniture. The only down fall was that the queen size was harder and stiffer than a theraputic bed, but we couldn't complain bc we were only there for a short stay anyways. The ac at night made a lot of noise which made it hard to sleep at night but if u tell the front desk they will fix it. The resturant/bar area was located downstairs in an open area that had views of the ocean and live music at night. The restaurant had affordable and reasonble items on the menu. The kitchen was open until 12am. When u exited the hotel to go outside, you literally stepped onto the beach. At night I would strongly recommend for people to stay at the hotel or the beach near the hotel, and not wonder off. The streets leading to the main street off the hotel are dark. If you plan on wondering off and discover the night life, take ur rented car or more preferably a taxi which only ran$ 5 dollars on the isla verde street, or $10-15 to old san juan area. But honestly there is no need to wonder off but you have everything at this hotel. We would only go sightseeing during the day which was amazing because we were close to everything. It is located 5minutes from the airport, 10 minutes from san juan/old san juan area, 20minutes from the rainforest el yunque, 20minutes from plaza americas. I strongly recommend this hotel to everyone for a short stay just at the fact that the beds are hard and that it is not ur average huge commercial resort. It is a peaceful small boutique hotel meant for relaxation. I loved it, its afforable and welcoming. Next time we plan on going to pr for another short trip before a cruise or before another destination

Reviews.Title: “best spot to be relaxing”
Reviews.Author: becky107
Reviews.Content: I have been to la playa hotel several times and I always seem to go back since they have such nice staff family owed hotel and well kept. I love the pina coladas and the foodis very good the breeze feels so good and the people here are even better. This place is just steps from the beach and also walking distance to all the main hotel and restaurants. If you would like a nice quiet place to relax have a drink and get some sun and get some fresh air this is the place to be . we are going back in august cant wait.

Reviews.Title: “boutique haven (with manatees!) on the beach”
Reviews.Author: louise_rider
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel after a week long business trip. The previous week, we stayed at the home of local friends in Caguas while traveling around the island. We decided to have one night of a vacation experience before flying home to the states. So, we stayed here, sight unseen, because of the strong recommendation of several Puerto Rican friends. After seeing the bad experience described on Trip Advisor, I was a little wary, but we decided to trust the locals. And boy were our friends right about this place. It's just lovely. Since we came during the off season, we were able to arrive without a reservation and check in to a room immediately. For just under one hundred dollars, we rented this lovely room and received a fresh continental breakfast in the morning. Incredible value for the super touristy Isla Verde. The rooms all open to not a drab carpeted hallway but to a central beautiful courtyard, with pretty landscaping and high quality patio furniture. The rooms were on the smaller side, but beautifully furnished with dark wood furniture: two queen beds with four pillows each, central nightstand, a large closet with a safe, a comfy lounge chair, lovely tiled bath, and a flatscreen television carrying many English channels. And yes, it was so incredibly clean!!! I can't emphasize that enough. Our room was on the second story with a side view of the ocean. We left the windows open (they do have screens) to smell the sea air as we were sleeping. I really appreciated the eco-friendly nature of the hotel, even the soaps were labeled to be organic and without animal testing, I believe. The hotel is literally steps from the huge beach, with jet-ski rental, para-sailing and surfing lessons within walking distance. I especially appreciated that the whole place displays local paintings and sculpture. I even saw that there were hosting an art opening at their space within the next couple of weeks. It's so wonderful to see a hotel supporting its local arts community instead of using the same old generic mass produced prints in its decor. Yes, the service was incredible. Everyone made an effort to speak some English, smile and offer suggestions to you. The hotel even has access to a roof deck with incredible beach and ocean views. I imagine it would be a great place to bring a nice bottle of wine and watch a sunset. I think this wonderful restaurant is really what makes La Playa a truly unique in Isla Verde. I did not see any other hotels on the strip that had a restaurant literally on the water. Even if you don't stay here, come for at least one meal. As others have mentioned, part of the restaurant is a patio built on piers. The waves splash underneath you as you drink you coffee in the morning, you look out on the ocean, and see, yes, manatees! playing in front of you. It is undergoing a menu change into a wine bar with 70+ different bottles and live local music on the weekends. Their bottled beer selection was also impressive. I just enjoyed sitting on this patio feeling the ocean spray, drinking coffee, and watching surfers. perfect. This is not where to go for a traditional, never leave the premises resort experience. What it is, is a perfect place to relax and enjoy the beach for a few days; or a great home base as you explore the island. I could see spending the day snorkeling in Culebra, hiking El Yunque or shopping in Old San Juan, then coming home to this beautiful spot, close to the airport. In short: lovely decor, great service, beach access, free parking, comfortable rooms, and a wonderful daily breakfast. I almost didn't want to write this review because I don't want it to become so busy and expensive I can't go back! Enjoy it while you can. Nos vemos pronto, Playita!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a great value!”
Reviews.Author: sedutta
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at La Playa hotel for the two nights we were in San Juan before heading off on a cruise. I chose this hotel because, unlike the other beachfront (and not so beachfront) hotels on Isla Verde, this looked to be the best value for location. The location was excellent. While there was no accessible beach area directly at the hotel, the beach was across a small street- no dodging traffic or anything. The rooms weren't fancy, but who's going to spend time in the room? Our room (a double) was very clean, very quiet, and very comfortable. The bathroom looked like it had been updated and we even had a side view of the ocean. The hotel bar and restaurant was beautiful- it was an open area that was right on the ocean. And I mean right on top of the ocean. If you were on the deck and the sea was a bit rough, you definitely got at least sprinkled whenever the waves crashed. The food and drinks were a little overpriced, but pretty much in line with any of the other beachfront restaurants in the area. The service was a bit slow, but we were never in a rush, so it didn't bother us. Food and drinks were very good, too. It was an easy walk to the main street of Isla Verde, where there are lots of restaurants, bars, and shops. We ate at a restaurant one night, but didn't go to any bars or clubs, so can't really offer any views on that. One note is that the service at La Playa was excellent. It is a small hotel (15 rooms, I think) and has the feel of a family run place. Everyone we interacted with was very helpful and nice. We had to have a package overnighted to the hotel and the front desk was gracious enough to call us at 8:30 in the evening while we were out to dinner to let us know that it had arrived. This is a place we will definitely stay at again without any hesitations!

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love with this hotel....”
Reviews.Author: JanetC
Reviews.Content: I'm not even sure how I stumbled across the hotel in Trip Advisor but I'm glad I did. Was looking for something reasonable and close to the airport and I found so much more. I thought this hotel was adorable...reminded me of an old school hotel in Miami or something. I loved walking in and hearing Jimmy Buffet, etc over the speakers, too. It is right on the water but you need to walk across the street to get to the actual beach. I was upgraged to an ocean view room upon arrival..this room was great and what a view (if you are staying awhile, it would be worth the extra money, I think). There is a restaurant and bar here which overlooks the water...food was good and they had live music (tho, that did go somewhat late). Now, this is definitely not a 4/5 star hotel, more like a 3 star but it's very cute and a good value for the money. In fact I would have given it 5 stars except I had a lot of problems with the shower and getting hot water (which I also had in OSJ-so might be a broad problem). I personally would stay in OSJ over Isla Verde but this is def a good option if it fits what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Little Nightmare By The Beach...”
Reviews.Author: GRAYandGIGI
Reviews.Content: We were so excited about this little spot we found! We had researched & compared deciding we did not want a cookie cutter hotel room and so chose Hotel La Playa. Walking in through the entrance the plants & manicured greenery were inviting & quaint. If this was the entrance we thought the rooms would be great! Only one room was available for our stay, for some reason no one booked it the whole week. The gentleman at the reception was kind enough to show us the room briefly. We came in & out after 10 seconds noting the view of the water & the super tiny balcony area which appeared neglected, with 2 white plastic chairs thrown about by the rain. The "balcony"'s view to the left was an abandoned hotel & trash surrounding it. If we booked it the "balcony" would be prepared nicely we were told. Although we thought the price was high & tried to get a discount to no avail (the online price was cheaper), being tired we gave in. Arriving a day or two later around 8:00PM we brought our luggage up with help. My mother in law joined us. The lady that evening, Lucy, told us there was a shortage of pillows to use one from our bed. We had 4 on our bed so we pulled one out for mother to use. Unpacking I went to the restroom & noticed a used towel hanging to dry on the ironing board... The toilet had a strange goo on the seat, we hoped it was some sort of cleaning chemical... While washing my hands I noticed the tiles to the left were covered with what looked like accumulated toothpaste rinse water splatter from past guests...We walked out to the "balcony" & saw it was exactly as we had seen it except for a small frail plant with 3 leaves (not the lush plants at the entrance or in the balcony next door), a beat up tiny round table and an extra plain wet plastic chair. There was what looked like to be a pole for an umbrella yet no umbrella just wet everything. Ok we thought at least we have a view... We pulled the curtain to the window at the left to reveal an ugly wood panel, was it covering an old A/C hole, a broken window??? It looked to have been ignored by many as layers of dust on & around this window disaster were discovered by our fingers. Lets put some drinks in the fridge, we need something to cool us down, but no small refrigerator. We decided to shop for a cooler & ice. The room key opens it & locks it so when our mother decided to stay we were actually locking her in, which we thought would be horrible if there were a real emergency. Lucy told us there was no extra key, which we found to be alarming. Anyhow, we just left the key with our mother & had to wake her up to open the door when we returned. Going for a brief walk before bed we sat by the water on the wet plastic chairs though we could only hear but not see the unlit black waves hitting the small dock. After sitting in the dark for 10 minutes we went upstairs & my wife noticed a small bite on her forehead & applied ice on it. There was a bright light in the balcony that would shine through the door, since we could not find the switch I unscrewed it... We wanted to hear the waves as we slept but there were no screens so we closed the windows & went to bed. At 2AM my wife wakes me up telling me she could not open her left eye. The left side of her face was unbelievably swollen & huge! Quickly I went to a 24HR drugstore & got some antihistamine. At 3AM we were at the Emergency Room of a local hospital. They ran labs & hooked her up to some IVs. All for 12 hrs.! While she took this treatment I went to the hotel to get our things & ask for a refund for the extra days. As I waited another guest told me how the week before she was ill with Dengue from a mosquito bite while at the hotel!! We did not want to go through any further risks so they were nice enough to refund the nights we were not staying... At the end we fled to a nearby Doubletree that was a true haven for us. Hotel La Playa has the potential to be a great spot. It has no bells & whistles yet lacks some basics as well. That it is by the water is true but I would not go back unless they put themselves in their guests shoes. Then they would be more observant & considerate...& keep their guests.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best experiences I've had in the Caribbean”
Reviews.Author: LJRivera
Reviews.Content: The last time I visited La Playa hotel was back when I was a teenager and it still had more of a motel feel. Now, many years later (I'm almost 30), it has been renovated to something of a boutique style without losing its Caribbean flair. The staff was remarkably attentive and personable. Two of my friends and I shared the double bed ocean front room which gave us a beautiful view of the water right below and the beaches in the distance. The location of the hotel is prime. You can visit many local clubs and sights without having to pay the sometimes outrageous prices of the El San Juan or the Intercontinental. We never had a problem parking our rental car (for free) and a security guard or valet was almost always around to watch your vehicle. Lastly, La Playita Restaurant and bar which is located on the first floor of the hotel has a laid back and romantic feel that is not met anywhere else in Isla Verde. And the food - DELICIOUS and well priced in an area where other restaurants often take advantage of the tourist crowd. My friends and I cannot wait to return to La Playa.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is the Bang for the Buck within a Large Hotel Cluster!”
Reviews.Author: kweninc
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a hidden gem. It seems to be the smallest hotel within a cluster of major HIgh rises. My very picky wife loved the room, Lucy at the front desk is the sweetest & Mario has the best advice far as entertainment to suit your needs. To rent jetski is only a 2min. 45 sec walk from the hotel. the beach is less than 30 seconds away. We came to San juan on memorial day party Group(urban fiesta)..and everyone within the group stayed in surrounding hotels, so it was good to be away from the loud party people at times. The food is very good & fresh: for ex. my wife yogurt was made there on the spot & our orange juice was freshly squeezed that morning! Every entree seemed prepared by a professional chef. Food was reasonably priced we spent anywhere from $5-$14 per meal per person. the hotels beer is the cheapest in the area $3 per Corona while every other hotel charge $6-$9 per beer. The room bed was plush comfortable & CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN! Ceramic Tile was all over the floor bathroom walls we were very pleased! we will be back again & again

Reviews.Title: “great value for money but not flashy or touristy”
Reviews.Author: KarenCan
Reviews.Content: What a find - no airplane noise, staff helpful, absolute waterfront breakfast area and a basic but clean and quiet room. If you want a flashy room and lots of frills, go somewhere else and pay lots more, but this was the great value for an overnight near the airport. I would happily return for longer.

Reviews.Title: “Much better places to stay.”
Reviews.Author: mikekilljoy
Reviews.Content: Simply put, if you want a small little motel by the water, then this is the place for you. Other than that, I would have much rather stayed at a real hotel than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean View Room & The Coqui @ Nite Paradise in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: gemini52957
Reviews.Content: I was Pleasantly Surprised how Lovely The Ocean Looked From My room 201 & The sound of The coqui @ Nite AHHH:) The Bed was SOOO Comfortable & Clean as the room. When I First Opened The Curtains ( YIKES) All the Men Walking across the Street saw my boobies by Accident, So keep in Mind The Windows are Low & Wide. Mr Alberto Perez ( Owner), Monica, Linda & Lucy Treated Me like a Celebrity, Inspite the Rude Employee Angel that Shoved My Lunch on my Tanned Chest, Mr Perez Handled The Situation Promptly & Much Appreciated Complimentary Champagne & DELICIOUS Appetizers. " THE HAMBURGER LUNCH SPECIAL IS AWESOME $ 5.00" 4 STARS YUMMY!!! :) I'll Miss Carlos, He Helped me with My Bags coming & Going & Was well compensated$$$$, The Restaurant View & The Soulful Jazz Music is My Scene Thank you for That, On my Last day Complimentry Coffee & Toasted English was Superb While I'm sipping my Coffee Before Leaving For NYC..The Music Playing was: I'm In a New york State of Mind" Wow I cried :( How Ironic ? Overall The bar is Spacious & Friendly & The View of The OCEAN!!! " PRICELESS"

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path . . . totally exceeds expectations!”
Reviews.Author: travel2extreme
Reviews.Content: Located literally at the waters' edge, at the far end of Isla Verde beach, sits Hotel La Playa. Tucked away in a corner, off the beaten path, and hard to find, this hotel is truly a hidden gem. It is under new ownership, and the owner has done quite a job with the place. The rooms are immaculate, and some of them (i.e Room #209) are more of a mini-suite with balconies and ocean views. The doors to the rooms have a special locking feature that prevents dampness in the rooms, even in the most humid conditions. The beds are amazingly comfortable. The staff is small and very friendly; you will know most of them by first name, including the owner, by the end of your stay. The restaurant literally sits at the oceans' edge, and has daily lunch specials for $5. Why pay hundreds to stay at a high-rise, only to have a garden view and spend even more at their over-priced restaurants, when you can stay here, at the oceans edge, seconds from the beach, with a staff that truly wants to make sure you enjoy your time. We will definitely return to Hotel La Playa.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE SAN JUAN”
Reviews.Author: RedRyda
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a fun and relaxing getaway---San Juan is the place to be. Beautiful people, great food, relaxing beaches and a fun night life. Me and 11 of my girlfriends were there for a girls trip!!! We stayed at the La Playa Hotel--it's a small family owned and operated hotel in Isla Verde. The rooms are just ok, the view was awesome and the service was very personable. This hotel is in walking distance or short cab ride to a great night life. We were fortunate enough to encounter this fabulous local cabi --"Bully" who knew EVERYTHING about the area and we hired him the entire time we were there and at a very fair rate. If you in PR and you need a cabi---CALL HIM! [---]. GOOD FOOD- EL Jibarito- Delish Local Authenic, Old San Juan Metropol--FAB!! Mostly Cuban Food---DELISH! Isla Verde Barrachina--VERY NICE--Great Food, live Music, Old San Juan Hot Clubs-- El San Juan Hotel---Just hang out in the lobby for lots of hotties The Bed Lounge--OMG! We had so much fun, we went 2 nights this is an R&B Hip Hop Club We also went to this area in Isla Verde that had several clubs in one area--we bar hopped and that was cool. All types of clubs and music. Shopping---Old San Juan----great shops but those darn hills were trecherous. WEAR SNEAKERS.

Reviews.Title: “Best getaway ever”
Reviews.Author: AMPMMiami
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, great views, excellent service, delicious food. Can't wait to go back, we went a couple of days for my birthday and it was great. I went there years ago, and now it's a complete different place! Loved it! It's so close to everything, the beach is a minute away, you can rent a car a go to the Old San Juan, or you can just walk around the area and will find everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJBLTB
Reviews.Content: We took a chance at this little hotel because it is under new management and we spoke personally to the staff before the trip. The have redone the hotel and restaurant and it is great. Ten steps out the front door and you are on the same beach as the El San Juan and Intercontinental. A short walk up the street and you are on the beach of the Ritz Carlton. The location is great for restaurants and access to the bus. The room was a little small but we spent little time in the room. The hotel and room were extremely clean and the staff was very accommodating. There is always someone there to help if you need it. The restaurant was good also and the hotel offered continental breakfast as part of the room rate. We would stay there again without question!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel La Playa
HotelInfo.Address: 6 Calle Amapola, Isla Verde 00979, Puerto Rico
